changes_made: Removed Filter button component with secondary variant styling
Restructured JSX layout by removing wrapping Box container with flex gap
Simplified SearchField placement by moving it directly into parent flex container

patterns_discovered.description: When removing UI components that depend on specific Material-UI icons, both the import statement and the component using that icon are removed together
Removing a flex container wrapper and promoting child elements to the parent level when only one child remains or when grouping is no longer needed
When removing components from a flex layout, the gap property that provided spacing between elements is also removed

gotchas_discovered.description: Moving SearchField from a nested flex container to the parent level changes the alignment context. The SearchField must maintain consistent sizing/alignment with the new parent constraints.
FilterListIcon was only used in the Filter button. Removing the button requires checking that this icon import is no longer referenced elsewhere in the file.

approach_outcome.implementation_notes: Straightforward removal of UI component. The Filter button was cleanly isolated and had no dependencies on other parts of the component. Removal only required deleting the button element and its icon import, plus minor JSX restructuring.

recommendations.recommendation: Verify that the SearchField aligns properly in the flex container after removing its wrapper Box. Test responsive behavior at different viewport widths.
Confirm that removing the Filter button doesn't impact user workflows. If filtering was a planned feature, document the decision or track as a future enhancement.
The gap spacing removal from the flex container is appropriate since only one child (SearchField) remains in the left section. Confirm this is the intended visual layout.
